description.narrative: The two day seminar of The Finnish Social Forum 2015 consists of presentations workshops and discussions of various combinations. Major emphasis is placed on seeking new ways of acting which passes through the whole event. Central basis for the event is to welcome representatives from Developing countries for the purpose to bind the forum to authentic knowledge and experience. Social Forum 2015 aims to highlight global problems for which finding solutions are experienced as the most acute at the present. If we can achieve consensus regarding these themes the utilization of the capabilities of all participating associations for change becomes more plausible. So the aim of the project is to create new networks between actors who are devoted to promote Global Justice democratically.The key assets and main attraction are the guests invited from Developing countries. Through their presence the central development questions and the lives of the people in those countries become more concrete to the Forum participan ts. The project supports financially the invitation of experts proposed by the associations who produce the contents for the Forum. The number of quests invited from Developing countries will be increased. To gain more grassroots viewpoints to global prob lems an opportunity is opened for refugees who have arrived to Finland. This invitation concerns also immigrant currently living in Finland.The information provided by the quests is distributed through the projects communications department to different or ganizations and Medias. Discussion between the special quests and organizations political parties state institutions labor representatives as well as other actors in society is encouraged in the form of various meetings and sessions. Furthermore the aim is to create permanent relationships between Finnish organizations and our quests in order to secure lasting cooperation.
